subject: Re: User email address enumeration vulnerability on upload.ee
bodyHtml:
Hello!

Thank you for improving the password reset form this quickly. However, small-scale targeted exploitation is still possible.

Regarding user experience of messaging, you can send an email in both cases, but differentiate the email message based on account existence. For example, for new registration, provide means for account activation, and for existing accounts, provide means for account recovery.


Thank you for the example of Github. We are aware that this issue has been often overlooked. Regardless, we believe that any possible leaks are in violation of GDPR.


In contrast to seb.ee, the upload.ee website exposes account existence by email address. Usernames that are offered by service providers are not public information: they are not generally available nor can they be linked to specific persons by third parties. This means revealing account existence for an arbitrary account ID should not violate GDPR. While I could not check seb.ee myself, I did confirm that swedbank.ee uses email addresses merely as contact information and allows duplicates across accounts without informing about reuse.


Thank you for pointing out the contact form and the proper email address. However, we wanted to make sure example images are provided and thus opted to send a PDF report â€“ this would not have been possible over the contact form. To the best of our ability, we could not find the info@upload.ee email and did not want to blindly try, as we wanted the report to reach only the correct people. Regardless, we recommend implementing a security.txt file with guidelines for future vulnerability reports. More information: https://securitytxt.org.


Best regards,
Gregor Eesmaa
Computer Science MSc student
University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

Sent from Outlook for iOS
